definition: to talk or act with noisy swaggering threats
examples: brags and blusters but rarely does what he says he'll do

definition: to blow in stormy noisy gusts

examples: … when autumn blusters and the orchard rocks.
"I don't want to hear it!" he blustered.

definition: to drive or force by blustering
examples: … trying to bluster us into the belief that they are much better than they look.
… the strong breeze driving them was setting up a bluster on the water.
They do their work without bluster or ostentation.
growing tired of his macho bluster
